results.name: a(n) = A046523(A284003(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8191
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
formula: a(n) = A002110(A001222(A284003(n))) = A002110(A209281(n))). [Latter so far only conjectured.]
mathematica: Table[Times @@ MapIndexed[Prime[First@ #2]^#1 &, Reverse@ Sort@ FactorInteger[#][[All, -1]]] - Boole[# == 1] &@ Apply[Times, FactorInteger[#] /. {p_, e_} /; e > 0 :> Times @@ (p^Mod[e, 2])] &[Times @@ Map[#1^#2 & @@ # &, FactorInteger[#] /. {p_, e_} /; e == 1 :> {Times @@ Prime@ Range@ PrimePi@ p, e}] &[Times @@ Prime@ Flatten@ Position[#, 1] &@ Reverse@ IntegerDigits[n, 2]]], {n, 0, 52}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 18 2017 *)
program: \\ Code for A284003 given under that entry.
A046523(n) = my(f=vecsort(factor(n)[, 2], , 4), p); prod(i=1, #f, (p=nextprime(p+1))^f[i]) \\ From _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 17 2011
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 18 2017
